intro: Lithospermum griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's rock pepper, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Lithospermum griffithii is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in alpine or arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within its native habitat.
